question: In mice immunized with α-myosin heavy chain (α-MyHC) peptide in complete Freund’s adjuvant, does genetic deficiency of interferon-γ or its receptor increase the susceptibility and severity of experimental autoimmune myocarditis compared with wild-type controls? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Lack of IFN-gamma due to either depletion with an antibody or a genetic deficiency exacerbated myocarditis.
content.source_2: In α-MyHC/CFA-induced experimental autoimmune myocarditis, mice deficient in IFN-γ or IFN-γR showed reduced disease incidence and attenuated inflammatory infiltrates compared with wild-type controls.
content.source_3: In contrast, IFN-gamma plays a protective role.
content.source_4: Blockade of IFN-γ signaling during priming prevented the development of myocarditis, and IFN-γ–knockout mice were resistant to α-MyHC/CFA challenge.
